info.title: Desk.com
info.description: Integrate Desk.com's customer service tools directly into your Web site or application. Create cases, customer profiles, content, macros & track interactions.

parameters.name: subdomain
parameters.description: The subdomain configured for your Desk.com application.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The API version.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The response format.

get.description: Searches cases based on a combination of parameters with pagination.

parameters.name: subdomain
parameters.description: The subdomain configured for your Desk.com application.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The API version.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The case ID.

parameters.name: by
parameters.description: Specify what to find the case by. Can either be 'id' or 'external_id'. If none specified, defaults to 'id'.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The case's subject.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: The cases external_id.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The case's description.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The case's priority (1-10).

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: The case's labels. This is a comma delimited list of label names. Any existing labels that are not specified will be removed, and any new labels will be added.

parameters.name: custom_key
parameters.description: The custom field identified by key.

parameters.name: case_status_type_id
parameters.description: The case's status type identifier. Can be one of the following: 10 (New), 30 (Open), 50 (Pending), 70 (Resolved).

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The case's assigned user id.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The case's assigned group id.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The case's language. This will only be accepted if the multi-language support is turned on for the site and the language is enabled from the Admin.

parameters.name: subdomain
parameters.description: The subdomain configured for your Desk.com application.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The API version.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The response format.

parameters.name: custom_key
parameters.description: Match customers by a custom field value denoted by key.

parameters.name: since_created_at
parameters.description: Match customers with a created date (in unix time) greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified Date.

parameters.name: max_created_at
parameters.description: Match customers with a created timestamp (in unix time) less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified Date.

parameters.name: since_updated_at
parameters.description: Match customers with an updated timestamp (in unix time) greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified Date.

parameters.name: max_updated_at
parameters.description: Match customers with an updated timestamp (in unix time) less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified Date.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Match customers with ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.

parameters.name: max_id
parameters.description: Match customers with ID less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified ID.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Match customers by a comma separated list of email addresses.

parameters.name: twitter
parameters.description: Match customers by a comma separated list of twitter logins.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Match customers by a comma separated list of phone numbers.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Match customers by a comma separated list of external ids.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Specifies the number of records to retrieve. May not be greater than 100.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies the page of results to retrieve. Note: there are pagination limits. See the FAQ for details.

get.description: Searches and returns a paginated collection of customers.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The customer's full name.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The customer's company.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The customer's title.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The customer's background information.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: The customer's external identifier.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Additionally create the customer's default email address. This will eventually be deprecated in favor of customers/emails/create.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Additionally create the customer's default phone number. This will eventually be deprecated in favor of customers/phones/create.

parameters.name: twitter
parameters.description: The customer's twitter account. This will create an associated twitter account to the customer. An associated twitter account can not be created if it is already assigned to an existing customer.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The customer's language. This will only be accepted if the multi-language support is turned on for the site and the language is one of the supported languages.

parameters.name: custom_key
parameters.description: The custom field identified by key.

parameters.description: The subdomain configured for your Desk.com application.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The API version.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The response format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The customer ID.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The customer's full name.

parameters.name: company

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The customer's title.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The customer's background information.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: The customer's external_id. This represents the customer's unique ID in your client application.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The customer's language. This will only be accepted if the multi-language support is turned on for the site and the language is one of the supported languages.

parameters.name: custom_key
parameters.description: The custom field identified by key.

parameters.name: subdomain
parameters.description: The subdomain configured for your Desk.com application.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The API version.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The response format.

parameters.name: case_id
parameters.description: The numerical ID of the desired case interactions.

parameters.name: channels
parameters.description: Channel types (comma delimited list of channels).

parameters.name: since_created_at
parameters.description: Returns results with an Create Date greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified Date.

parameters.name: max_created_at
parameters.description: Returns results with an Create Date less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified Date.

parameters.name: since_updated_at
parameters.description: Returns results with an Update Date greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified Date.

parameters.name: max_updated_at
parameters.description: Returns results with an Update Date less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified Date.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Returns results with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.

parameters.name: max_id
parameters.description: Returns results with an ID less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified ID.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Specifies the number of records to retrieve. May not be greater than 100.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies the page of results to retrieve. Note: there are pagination limits. See the FAQ for details.

get.description: Returns the first X interactions within the system with pagination.

parameters.name: interaction_subject
parameters.description: The subject of the new interaction.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The numerical ID of the customer you wish to link this new with. At least one of Customer ID, Customer Email, Customer Twitter, or Case ID must be supplied. If you supply case ID and customer information, the case ID will take precedence and use the existing customer linked to the case, ignoring all other customer API parameters.

parameters.name: customer_twitter
parameters.description: The twitter screenname of the customer you wish to create or link the new case to. At least one of Customer ID, Customer Email, Customer Twitter, or Case ID must be supplied. If you supply case ID and customer information, the case ID will take precedence and use the existing customer linked to the case, ignoring all other customer API parameters.

parameters.name: customer_email
parameters.description: The email address of the customer you wish to create or link the new case to. At least one of Customer ID, Customer Email, Customer Twitter, or Case ID must be supplied. If you supply case ID and customer information, the case ID will take precedence and use the existing customer linked to the case, ignoring all other customer API parameters.

parameters.name: case_id
parameters.description: The numerical ID of the case to associate this new interaction with.

parameters.name: customer_name
parameters.description: The full name of the customer (Create customer only).

parameters.name: customer_custom_key
parameters.description: The custom customer field identified by key (updates custom fields for the customer if it already exists, otherwise, will be initialized for a new customer record).

parameters.name: customer_language
parameters.description: The customer's language. This will only be accepted if the multi-language support is turned on for the site and the language is one of the supported languages.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: A string ID (max of 64 characters) of the case to associate this new interaction with. External IDs can be used to associate cases with IDs used within another external system.

parameters.name: case_labels
parameters.description: The labels to associate with the new case (create case only).

parameters.name: case_custom_key
parameters.description: The custom case field identified by key (create case only).

parameters.name: case_language
parameters.description: The case's language. This will only be accepted if the multi-language support is turned on for the site and the language is enabled from the Admin. If no language is supplied, the case will be created with the customers assigned language.

parameters.name: interaction_channel
parameters.description: The channel type of the new interaction ("email" or "phone"). Defaults to "email".

parameters.name: interaction_body
parameters.description: The full content of the interaction (email body or phone summary depending on channel type).

post.description: Creates a new interaction either by creating a new case or linking to an existing one.

get.description: Returns the first X articles for a given topic with pagination.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject of the article.

parameters.name: main_content
parameters.description: The main content of the article.

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Whether or not to publish this article. Defaults to false (draft).

parameters.name: show_in_portal
parameters.description: Whether or not to display this article in the Portal.

parameters.name: agent_content
parameters.description: Any private content only viewable by agents.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email response template when replying to an email case. Defaults to main_content.

parameters.name: chat
parameters.description: Chat response template when replying to a chat case. Defaults to main_content (truncates and provides an URL to public article).

parameters.name: twitter
parameters.description: Twitter response template when replying to a tweet case. Defaults to main_content (truncates and provides a URL to public article).

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: Question/Answer response template when replying to a Portal Question/Answer case. Defaults to main_content.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Phone response template when replying to a Phone case. Defaults to main_content.

parameters.name: quickcode
parameters.description: Quickcode for the article.

post.description: Creates a new article for a topic.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject of the article.

parameters.name: main_content
parameters.description: The main content of the article.

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Whether or not to publish this article. Defaults to false (draft).

parameters.name: show_in_portal
parameters.description: Whether or not to display this article in the Portal.

parameters.name: agent_content
parameters.description: Any private content only viewable by agents.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email response template when replying to an email case. Defaults to main_content.

parameters.name: chat
parameters.description: Chat response template when replying to a chat case. Defaults to main_content (truncates and provides an URL to public article).

parameters.name: twitter
parameters.description: Twitter response template when replying to a tweet case. Defaults to main_content (truncates and provides a URL to public article).

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: Question/Answer response template when replying to a Portal Question/Answer case. Defaults to main_content.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Phone response template when replying to a Phone case. Defaults to main_content.

parameters.name: quickcode
parameters.description: Quickcode for the article.

parameters.name: topic_id
parameters.description: Parent topic id for the article. This allows you to move an article to a different topic on your site.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The article's language. This will only be accepted if the multi-language support is turned on for the site and the language is enabled from the Admin.

parameters.name: mark_translations_outdated
parameters.description: Set to 'true' when updating the default language (or not specifying one) to mark all article translations as out-of-date. NOTE: translations are only marked as out-of-date if at least one attribute is changed on the articles default langauge. If content is changed on a translated version of the article this flag is ignored.

delete.description: Deletes a single article, specified by the ID.

parameters.description: Sets labels for the macro. Accepts a comma separated list of label names. Any labels that do not exist will be created.

parameters.name: enable

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Sets labels for the macro. Accepts a comma separated list of label names. Any labels that do not exist will be created.

parameters.name: version

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The response format.

parameters.name: macro_id
parameters.description: The macro ID.

get.description: Returns actions for a given macro.

parameters.name: subdomain
parameters.description: The subdomain configured for your Desk.com application.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The API version.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The response format.

parameters.name: macro_id
parameters.description: The macro ID.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The action type slug.

get.description:
Returns a single macro action, specified by the macro ID and one of the action type slugs below:
- set-case-description: The description to be applied to a case.
- set-case-labels: The labels to be set on a case, removing any labels already applied to the case. Value must be a comma separated list of label names. New labels will be created if they do not exist.
- append-case-labels: The labels to be appended to a case, keeping any labels already applied to the case. Value must be a comma separated list of label names. New labels will be created if they do not exist. 
- set-case-priority: The priority to be applied to a case. Value must be a number (1-10) representing the priority (1 being lowest, 10 being highest).
- set-case-status: The status to be applied to a case. Value must be one of the following status IDs: 30 (Open), 50 (Pending), 70 (Resolved).
- set-case-agent: The agent to be assigned to a case. Value must be the ID of the agent.
- set-case-group: The group to apply to the case. Value must be the ID of the group.
- append-case-article: The article to be appended to a case. Value must be the ID of the article.
- set-case-quick-reply: Quick reply on a case.
- set-case-outbound-email-subject: Set the case's outbound email subject.
- set-case-custom-key: Set the case's custom field, where key is the key of the custom field.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value of the action. Value is dependent on the action type.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: If enabled, the action will be performed when using the macro. Defaults to false.

put.description:
Updates an action for a given macro, specified by the action's slug. Every action has a value that will be applied when invoking the macro. The following list of values are available, depending on the action type:
- set-case-description: The description to be applied to a case.
- set-case-labels: The labels to be set on a case, removing any labels already applied to the case. Value must be a comma separated list of label names. New labels will be created if they do not exist.
- append-case-labels: The labels to be appended to a case, keeping any labels already applied to the case. Value must be a comma separated list of label names. New labels will be created if they do not exist. 
- set-case-priority: The priority to be applied to a case. Value must be a number (1-10) representing the priority (1 being lowest, 10 being highest).
- set-case-status: The status to be applied to a case. Value must be one of the following status IDs: 30 (Open), 50 (Pending), 70 (Resolved).
- set-case-agent: The agent to be assigned to a case. Value must be the ID of the agent.
- set-case-group: The group to apply to the case. Value must be the ID of the group.
- append-case-article: The article to be appended to a case. Value must be the ID of the article.
- set-case-quick-reply: Quick reply on a case.
- set-case-outbound-email-subject: Set the case's outbound email subject.
- set-case-custom-key: Set the case's custom field, where key is the key of the custom field.

info.title: Desk.com
info.description: Integrate Desk.com's customer service tools directly into your Web site or application. Create cases, customer profiles, content, macros & track interactions.
